content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the column name to lower case and then removes any leading or trailing white spaces. It uses the `replace` function with a regular expression (regex) to replace all spaces and hyphens with underscores.
